content: The Act titled "CFPB Constitutional Reform Act of 2017" replaces the director with a 5-person commission. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace the Bureau director with a 5-member commission appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to establish a 5-member commission appointed by the President with staggered 5-year terms. Members must be US citizens with expertise in consumer financial products and services. The President can remove any member for inefficiency. The commission members can be removed for inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and members can continue to serve until a successor is appointed and confirmed. The commission members can be removed for inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and members can continue to serve until a successor is appointed and confirmed. Members may not continue to serve more than 1 year after their term would expire. No member can engage in other employment. Not more than 3 members can be from the same political party. The Chair is appointed by the President and is the principal executive officer of the commission. The Chair of the commission is responsible for appointing and supervising personnel, distributing business among staff and units, and managing funds. The Chair must adhere to the commission's general policies and regulatory decisions. Vacancies in the commission do not impair its functions. The commission's vacancies do not impair its functions. Three members constitute a quorum for business transactions, but in case of vacancies, the quorum requirement may be adjusted. The commission shall have an official seal, and the Chair receives compensation according to the Executive Schedule. The commission's Chair receives compensation at the rate prescribed for level I of the Executive Schedule under section 5313 of title 5, United States Code, while the other 4 members receive compensation at the rate prescribed for level II of the Executive Schedule under section 5314 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 3. DEEMING OF NAME. Any reference to the Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection in US laws, regulations, or records will be considered a reference to the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director of the Bureau with "Bureau" and to replace references to "Director" with "Bureau" except in certain cases. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director of the Bureau with "Bureau" and to replace references to "Director" with "Bureau" except in certain cases, where specific titles are used instead. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director of the Bureau with "Chair of the Bureau" in various sections, including 1016(a), 1017(c)(1), 1027(l)(1), and 1066(a). Additionally, references to the Director of the Bureau are replaced with "Chair of the Bureau" in section 111(b)(1)(D) and section 1447 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director of the Bureau with "Chair of the Bureau" in various sections. This includes amendments to the Electronic Fund Transfer Act, Expedited Funds Availability Act, and Federal Deposit Insurance Act. In 1978, amendments were made to various acts to replace references to the Director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau with "Chair of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection". This change was applied to the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act, Financial Literacy and Education Improvement Act, and Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975. The Sales Full Disclosure Act, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974, and S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 are amended to replace references to the Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection with "Chair" or "Bureau" in various sections. The Licensing Act of 2008 is amended to replace references to the Director with "Bureau" in various sections.
